Ministarstvo: Za zagadjenje vazduha krivi saobraćaj i stari automobili

03 Nov 2019, 11:20









Ministarstvo zaštite životne sredine povodom Svetskog dana čistog vazduha 3. novembra, pozvalo je gradjane da napuste stare navike i okrenu se kvalitetnim motorima, hibridnim i električnim, kao i pešačenju i biciklizmu.U saopštenju se podseća da izveštaji Svetske zdravstvene organizacije pokazuju da je loš kvalitet vazduha u svetu uzrok smrti oko sedam miliona ljudi godišnje, dok u Srbiji svake godine umre 6.000 gradjana.Specijalizovana agencija Svetske zdravstvene organizacije za ispitivanje raka označila je kao dokazani humani kancerogen izduvne gasove dizel motora, navelo je ministarstvo i podsetilo da su prethodni dani pokazali koliko sami gradjani dramatično utiču na kvalitet vazduha."U danima kada nema grejanja, toplana, kada nema značajnog industrijskog zagadjenja, ali ni vetra ni kiše da pomognu, vazduh smo mogli da vidimo. Sada je i više nego jasno da je saobraćaj, njegova visoka učestalost, automobili i vozila sa zastarelim motorima, dramatično prisutni zagadjivač, neprijatelj našeg zdravlja i da je zadnji čas da svi toga postanemo svesni", ocenilo je ministarstvo.Poboljšanje kvaliteta vazduha je kako su dodali, zajednička briga i odgovornost svih nas, javnog i civilnog sektora, svake opštine, privrede, naučno-stručne javnosti, medija i gradjana.Rešenja su u selektivnom korišćenju automobila, inovativnim tehnologijama, zameni energenata, ulaganju u postrojenja za prečišćavanje vazduha, u cirkularnoj ekonomiji, u zelenoj gradnji, ocenilo je Ministarstvo zaštite životne sredine.

Ministry: Traffic and old cars are to blame for air pollution

03 Nov 2019, 12:20









The Ministry of the Environment, on the occasion of World Clean Air Day on November 3, urged citizens to abandon old habits and turn to quality engines, hybrid and electric, as well as hiking and biking. The world's leading cause of death is about seven million people a year, while 6,000 citizens die in Serbia each year. The World Health Organization's Specialized Agency for Cancer has identified as proven human carcinogenic diesel engine exhaust, the ministry said, and reminded that previous days showed how much the townspeople themselves dramatically affect the quality of the air. "In the days when there is no heating, the heating plant, when there is no significant industrial pollution, but neither wind nor rain to help, we could see the air. It is now and more than clear that traffic, its high frequency , cars and vehicles with obsolete engines, dramatically present for a disguster, an enemy of our health and that it is high time that we all become aware of this, "the ministry said. Improving air quality is, they added, a common concern and responsibility of all of us, public and civilian sector, every municipality, economy, scientific and professional public. The solutions are in selective use of cars, innovative technologies, replacement of energy, investment in air purification plants, in a circular economy, in green building, the Ministry of the Environment assessed.
